definition: Shennong or Farmer God (c. 2000 BC), first of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] and creator of agriculture in China/followers or clan of Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2]
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
variant of 農|农[nong2]
peasant/to farm/agriculture/diligent (old)/government field official (old)
surname Nong
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
clan name/maiden name

sentences.english: According to a Chinese ancient legend , Shen Nong discovered tea.
sentences.chinese: 根据一个中国古代的传说，神农氏发现了茶叶。

sentences.english: Don't you forget that Shennong, the Yan Emperor, was the chief of the ancient Qiang tribesmen.
sentences.chinese: 你忘了，这炎帝神农氏是古时候羌族的首领。

definition: Shennong or Farmer God (c. 2000 BC), first of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] and creator of agriculture
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
Flame Emperors (c. 2000 BC), legendary dynasty descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
alternative name for the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝
Suirenshi, legendary inventor of fire
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping, and writing
three sovereigns 三皇[san1 huang2] and five emperors 五帝[wu3 di4] of myth and legend/the earliest system of Chinese historiography
Di Ku or Emperor Ku, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
Yuwang (c. 2000 BC), last of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4], defeated by the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods
Zhuan Xu, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4], trad. reigned 2513-2435 BC
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4]
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
